name: W Austin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights last week for a wedding. We had a great time! The hotel is beautiful and the service is really top notch starting from check in, to the pool attendants to the wonderful valet folks. The pool can get crowded on weekends but otherwise it's a wonderful place to relax and catch some sun. The neighborhood is the best place to stay if you are visiting with everything within walking distance and you must get the breakfast tacos at the Blue Grocery on 3rd street just around the corner they are absolutely out of this world! We would definitely stay again next time we are in Austin!
reviews.title: Amazing Place to Stay Downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Not going to lie, but they pretty much think of everything. Great service, rooms, and an awesome pool. Heck they change the mats on the in front of the elevator 3 times a day: Good Morning, Good Afternoon, and Good Evening. Also left some of my valuables in the room and they shipped them to me the very next day!
reviews.title: 1st rate service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a staycation last weekend, and it was a complete bust. We arrived at 2 PM (check-in is at 3 PM) and were informed that our room was not yet ready but that we would be contacted via phone when it was. Based on that information, we expected to wait, at most, 30 minutes. We were left waiting until 3:20 PM. We noticed that other people trying to check-in were having problems, as well, so we went to the front desk to see about our room status. The person we spoke to told us that there were limited numbers of deck rooms, and that housekeeping had not had enough time to finish cleaning any of them, because guests had been checking out late. We couldn't believe that their excuse was that guests had been checking out late. Obviously they need stricter rules on guest check-out times. Regardless, after being offered 2 free drinks at their bar by the manager (which we accepted indifferently), they found a room for us. After settling in, we noticed stains everywhere: yellow ones in the blue carpet under the bed and black ones all along the curtains. The bathrobes had seen better days, but they were appreciated. It took us a while to realize that the master switch needs to be on for any electrical switch or outlet to work in the room. The shower is nothing special considering what you'd expect at that price level. The deck was great, though a little awkward since you could totally see/hear your neighbors when they were out on their decks. You could see down to the pool from the deck, and it seemed like it was hosting a Spring Break party or something since there was hardly any free space in or out of the pool, but we had heard that the hotel is lively on the weekends. Needless to say, it discouraged us from going down to enjoy the pool ourselves. We called, twice, for utensils to cut/eat the cake we had brought and never received them. We were awoken at least twice by extremely raucous guests in the hallways, each instance lasting at least 15 minutes. We had reservations at Trace for brunch the next morning but decided to cancel and check-out early as our experience was so thoroughly spoiled, we couldn't stand to stay another minute. This was my first W hotel experience, and I'm afraid it will likely be my last.
reviews.title: Absolutely Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013
reviews.text: I had a great stay at the W Hotel in Austin. The hotel was clean and conveniently located. If you need assistance with local attractions see Nicole. The pool gets crowded, so be prepared. The hotel was was very active and a lot of fun. The hotel is located in a great area of Austin. We will be back
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Richard was so very thoughtful, friendly and conscientious. We came in daily to see our family staying at the W and he remembered us each time, offering water, asking how my young children had enjoyed going swimming, etc. A great staff member!
reviews.title: Richard, doorman

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: I was lucky to stay at this hotel just a couple of weeks after grand openning. I think Janet Jackson was playing next door at the Austin Limits. Everything about this hotel is just awesome including the rooms..very trendy. The location is perfect. Plenty of great restaurants to walk to (safe area).
reviews.title: Must Stay for Austin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very convenient and up to W standards in every way. Be warned, there is no self parking and valet is $31 a night! The pool was literally packed with people drinking and visiting. I didn't see anyone getting out to use the bathroom so that is kinda yucky. But for all the partying going on there during the day the hotel was surprisingly quite during the night.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently spent 3 nights at the W Austin over the July 4th weekend with my wife and two dogs.
reviews.title: Definitely a 5 star experience (nearly)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Having stayed at numerous W Hotels all over the world it seemed logical to pick the W Austin particularly given the favorable pet policy – it also had some good write ups online.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We made a smart decision – unequivocally, this is the best W I have stayed in and despite the fact that nothing about our stay was cheap I can’t fault the experience – with two exceptions.
reviews.title: Above and Beyond

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First thing to note is that the hotel is a party hotel. Numerous guests stay up late to party and stumble back to their rooms at the crack of dawn. Hotel staff handles noise complaints decently, though it required multiple complaints before action was really taken. All in all a great hotel in a wonderful location, but my wife and I probably will note stay again just because of the type of loud partying guests that frequent this hotel.
reviews.title: Superb Service Overshadows Guest Stupidity

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I absolutely love your hotel - we came here for our 23rd anniversary tonight and were just thrilled to get away from our five kids. Erin, in your pool area, made it a really special night by taking notice that we were celebrating a special night and made arrangements to have a cake and bottle of champagne sent to our room with a personal note wishing us Happy Anniversary.
reviews.title: Outstanding Serrvice!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: She is a truly special person who she be praised and rewarded for making our special night such a very special evening. By the way, we never get away form home, so it was extra special. Thank you, for hiring such incredible staff, like Erin. What an an incredibly thoughtful person!!
reviews.title: Amazing Anniversary stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent our first wedding anniversary here and everything couldn't have been more perfect! A special thank you to concierge, Tony ,for helping me set up a surprise for my husband and especially for going out of your way to accommodate my wish for sparkling cider. We dropped our car off with Justin in valet and he was nice enough to help us with our luggage as well. Check-in with John at the front desk was very pleasant. He answered every question we had and he put us in an awesome room overlooking the lake. Everything was clean, comfy, and we thought the "minibar/snack area" in the room was the coolest thing! We both had a nice laugh at the pre-packaged pleasure kit. Very smart idea. The pool area was full of very entertaining and intoxicated young people, the bar was great-our only complaint is the shallowness of the pool. After enjoying a nice dip we headed downstairs for dinner. Our experience at Trace was top notch. Gabi, the hostess, let us sit where we pleased and upon hearing we were spending a special weekend brought us over some champagne. Mary waited our table and she was very friendly, engaging us in conversation and helping us choose the perfect meal. We had grilled octopus, wild game, and K1 strip. The secret to the food here is everything on the dish must be eaten together to fully enjoy the experience. The flavors were, as my husband put it, "an orgasm in your mouth." Kudos to the chef-they have a true gift for taste. At the end of our meal we were surprised once more with an amazing chocolate dessert. It was the perfect ending to one of the best dinners we have ever had!
reviews.title: Awesome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After an amazing sleep we had breakfast at Trace once more before our departure. We were waited on by Prometheus, who was very professional and attentive. He never let us see the bottom of our coffee cups and that was awesome! As we headed out to valet our car was promptly brought up to us by Alex. He wished us a nice trip home and an invite to return. We had such a fantastic time we will definitely be coming back,
reviews.title: Made me sad for my birthday...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Just stayed there for my 4th time in as many months. This W location is so far my favourite of all I have stayed in. From the check in though check out the staff were very attentive. The pool area was very enjoyable, the cool pool was a respite from the 100+ degree weather. The bar lounge in the lobby was really cool. I love the wall to wall shelves with vinyl records although I was upset they didnt play the Ernie & Bert record I found in their collection.
reviews.title: Epitome of Austin Cool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Such great service!! Spa was also excellent. Would definitely stay again!! Had our 2 1/2 year old daughter with us this time, and the staff treated her like a princess. :) Highly recommend this hotel. Just wish they had a bigger pool and/or one this is more "family friendly." They had a second pool, but I think it was for W residents only.
reviews.title: Amazing service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: As always the W delivered! I was looking for a chic spot with a great pool to celebrate a ladies weekend getaway. Our group is ages 28-30, technology and fashion professionals so we were looking for something fun but very classy. Let me be clear, the pool gets busy in the afternoons on weekends and the tunes are bumpin but this isn't Wet Republic (Vegas). It was a perfect balance of party and class.
reviews.title: Amazing Pool - Swanky as Expected!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013
reviews.text: We hit the pool early, about 10am on Friday and Saturday and it was very low-key, relaxing. I strongly recommend this time for families or anyone seeking a more relaxing experience. Drink service begins at 11am and the pool gets pretty full by 1pm. There are limited chairs but don't worry, mingling in the pool is strongly recommended! If the crowd makes you nervous, opt for a cabana or kasbah. We got a kasbah on Saturday and it was a total win. We arrived to find a basket of goodies including sunscreen and drink coupons. It was great to have our own space to stash bags, shoes, and enjoy a snack.
reviews.title: The best time of my life! The best service I have ever had in my life.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: As for the guests, the pool crowd was late 20s - early 40s. A good mix of bachelor/bachelorette parties, couples, friends, group trips. The second anyone got too rowdy - excessive splashing, etc security stopped by with a warning. I had a great time mingling, there weren't any creepy people as you sometimes get in Vegas pools... Also, this is the W so plan to look sexy! However, ladies, leave the heels in the room, the pavement is hot and you'll want some sandals/flip flops to easily run to the restroom in.
reviews.title: Overcrowded unusable pool area but nice room

description: Our hotel, located in downtown Austin, is next door to the famed Austin City Limits music venue. Our boutique hotel rooms are stylish and comfortable, we also offer over 10,000 sqft of event space.
